item.title: Vanessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "I'd like to go by climbing a birch tree~ And climb black branches up a snow-white trunk Toward heaven, till the tree could bear no more, But dipped its top and set me down again. That would be good both going and coming back. One could do worse than be a swinger of birches." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "Who are you to judge the life I live? I know I'm not perfect -and I don't live to be- but before you start pointing fingers... make sure you hands are clean!" -- Bob Marley

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Walker Percy
item.description: "I like to eat crawfish and drink beer. That's despair?" -- Walker Percy

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "I am at the moment writing a lengthy indictment against our century. When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occasional cheese dip." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "If you lived today as if it were your last, you'd buy up a box of rockets and fire them all off, wouldn't you?" -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "One reads books in order to gain the privilege of living more than one life. People who don't read are trapped in a mine shaft, even if they think the sun is shining." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Vanessa add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"<b>The preachers and lecturers deal with men of straw, as they are men of straw themselves</b>. Why, a free-spoken man, of sound lungs, cannot draw a long breath without causing your rotten institutions to come toppling down by the vacuum he makes. Your church is a baby-house made of blocks, and so of the state.
...The church, the state, the school, the magazine, think they are liberal and free! It is the freedom of a prison-yard." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Roy Blount Jr.
item.description: "If a cat spoke, it would say things like 'Hey, I don’t see the problem here." -- Roy Blount Jr.

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Larry Brown
item.description: "I didn't know why something that started off feeling so good had to wind up feeling so bad. Love was a big word and it covered a lot of territory. You could spend your whole life chasing after it and wind up with nothing, be an old bitter guy with long nose hair and ear hair and no teeth, hanging out in bars, looking for somebody your age, but the chances of success went down then. After a while you got too many strikes against you." -- Larry Brown

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Van Morrison
item.description: "and I shall watch the ferry boats, and they'll get high, on a bluer ocean against tomorrow's sky. and i will never grow so old again, and i will walk and talk, in gardens all wet with rain..." -- Van Morrison

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by T.F. Hodge
item.description: "To conquer frustration, one must remain intensely focused on the outcome, not the obstacles." -- T.F. Hodge
